intro: Fuirena erioloma, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often with a distinctive central disc. Fuirena erioloma thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
